SEARCH
Package netApi

Class Server<T extends ServerSideConnection>

java.lang.Object
netApi.Server<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of ServerSideConnection the server is associated with
public abstract class Server<T extends ServerSideConnection> extends Object
Class for hosting and managing clients. This essentially acts as a collection of ServerSideConnections that automatically updates when one joins or leaves.

  • Method Details

    • sendServerInfo

      public void sendServerInfo(SocketAddress a)
      Sends the server info to the SocketAddress a through udp (called automatically when clients are searching for servers and the server is public)
      Parameters:
      a - Destination of server info

    • getServerInfo

      public abstract byte[] getServerInfo()
      Abstract method that returns the server's info as an array of bytes (to be processed by ClientSideConnection.receiveServerInfo(InetSocketAddress, byte[]))
      Returns:
      Server's info as an array of bytes

      public void close() throws IOException
      Closes the server, clearing all clients and stopping all listeners.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • serverSideAuth

      public boolean serverSideAuth(SocketChannel client)
      Method used to authenticate the client when connecting to a server for security and to make sure that the client is connecting to the right type of server. This correlates to ClientSideConnection's ClientSideConnection.authenticate(SocketChannel) method. This method is currently undefined, and you should define it if you want added security to your program.
      Parameters:
      client - Ip address of client
      Returns:
      Whether the client passed authentication

    • addServerClient

      public void addServerClient(T c) throws IOException
      Adds a client to this server.
      Parameters:
      c - Client to be added
      Throws:
      IOException - If any I/O errors occur

    • removeServerClient

      public void removeServerClient(T c)
      Removes a ServerSideConnection from this server.
      Parameters:
      c - ServerSideConnection to be removed

    • removeServerClient

      public void removeServerClient(T c, String in)
      Removes a ServerSideConnection from this server.
      Parameters:
      c - ServerSideConnection to be removed
      in - Message sent to the ClientSideConnection upon disconnect

    • getUsers

      public ArrayList<T> getUsers()

    • stopAcceptingNewClients

      public void stopAcceptingNewClients() throws IOException
      Stops accepting new clients to join the server, you can restart accepting new clients through either calling open(), or setPublic(boolean)
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • restartAcceptingNewClients

      public void restartAcceptingNewClients() throws IOException
      Starts accepting new clients to join the server if the server is open, you can restart accepting new clients through either calling open(), or setPublic(boolean)
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • setPort

      public void setPort(int p) throws IOException
      Sets the port that the server should use and closes then reopens the server to apply this change
      Parameters:
      p - The port that the server should use (0 if it can use any)
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • acceptingNewClients

      public boolean acceptingNewClients()
      Returns whether the server is accepting new clients
      Returns:
      Whether the server is accepting new clients

    • getServerType

      public abstract int getServerType()
      Returns the type associated with the server. This should match the type of the server that the client wants to connect to (found from ClientSideConnection.getClientType() in the correlating ClientSideConnection class).
      Returns:
      The type associated with the server

    • getUdpPort

      public DatagramChannel getUdpPort()
      Returns the port used to broadcast server info (when public).
      Returns:
      The port used to broadcast server info (null when not public)

    • getSocket

      public ServerSocketChannel getSocket()
      Returns the socket used to open connections with clients.
      Returns:
      The socket used to open connections with clients

    • createClient

      public abstract T createClient(SocketChannel c) throws IOException
      Returns a new ServerClient of the type associated with this server.
      Parameters:
      c - The SocketChannel to be associated with the new ServerSideConnection
      Returns:
      A new ServerClient of the type associated with this server
      Throws:
      IOException - If an IO error occurs

    • clientConnectPreAuth

      public abstract void clientConnectPreAuth(T client)
      Fires when a client has attempted to connect to the server, but has not yet completed authentication
      Parameters:
      client - ServerSideConnection attempting to connect to the Server

    • clientCancelConnect

      public abstract void clientCancelConnect(T client)
      Fires when a client has stopped connecting to the server (this can happen for many reasons)
      Parameters:
      client - ServerSideConnection that has stopped connecting to the Server

      public abstract void clientConnectPostAuth(T client)
      Fires when a client has disconnected from the server
      Parameters:
      client - ServerSideConnection that has disconnected from the Server

    • clientDisconnect

      public abstract void clientDisconnect(T client, String reason)
      Fires when a client has disconnected from the server
      Parameters:
      client - ServerSideConnection that has disconnected from the Server
      reason - The reason provided (null if none was supplied) for the disconnect
